result.execSummary:
The defendant Donquell J Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intecept or other means.  All supervision fees.  All to be paid by end of supervision
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession/consumption/selling/distributed of ilegal drugs/alcohol.

Follow all rules of supervision.  Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a  DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donquell J Franklin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing 10/31/2014 received and filed. (35 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Public Defender Appointment, District Attorney, and Institution.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  7.5 YEARS with 248 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2.5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero;
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor . 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Donquell J Franklin in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for sentencing hearing, however due to an error during the first plea hearing, the plea is taken again.  10/13/2014 plea is vacated.
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armour.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial, however parties wish to proceed with a plea hearing.

Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered charge amended to Robbery, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Donquell J Franklin not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case remains calendared for jury trial in Branch 22 on 10/13/2014 at 9:00am.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Donquell J Franklin not in court, in custody.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Scott Obenberger appeared on behalf of one of the victims.

Final Pretrial scheduled for 09-24-2014 at 01:30pm and SPEEDY JURY TRIAL scheduled for 10-13-2014 at 09:00 am.
for witness Bobby Y.
for witness Dashia P.

Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22. Case calendared for SCHEDULING on 8/4/2014 at 8:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Court is in trial on an older matter. Court appointed Attorney Scott Obernberger to represent witness Bobby Y and appointed Attorney Chris Smoth to represent witness Dashia P. Attorneys are to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour with no repay by the witnesses.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Donquell J Franklin in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State filed an amended information adding:
Count 2: Armed Robbery - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime, pursuant to Wis Stat 943.32(2), 939.50(3)(c), 939.05, a class "C" Felony.
Count 3:
Armed Robbery - PTAC, As a Party to a Crime, pursuant to Wis Stat 943.32(2), 939.50(3)(c), 939.05, a class "C" Felony.
Defendant waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty to both counts.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Jane H Christopherson.  Defendant Donquell J Franklin in custody. Randy Sitzberger for Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defense filed their pretrial documents. Final Pretrial held. Case remains on the calendar for JURY TRIAL on 7/14/2014.

Attorney Jane H Christopherson in court, defendant Donquell J Franklin not in court, in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is not in session. Case rescheduled for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/30/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Jane Heather Christopherson in court, defendant Donquell J Franklin not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court waives defendants appearance for todays proceedings. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 6/20/2014 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 7/14/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Jane Heather Christopherson.  Defendant Donquell J Franklin in custody.  Denis Stingl, appearing for Karyn Behling, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Officer Richard Litwin.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Latoya W.; Denise G.; Marilyn S.; Theresa M.; Rachelle D.; Jada M.; Myra B.; Tazzaleen A.; James T.; Dashia P.; Bobby Y. and Floresa J.

Defendant Donquell J Franklin in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Donquell J Franklin in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defense to address bail on the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
